sen.j: 細川 氏綱（ほそかわ うじつな、永正11年（1514年） - 永禄6年12月20日 (旧暦)（1564年1月4日））は戦国時代 (日本)前期の武将で室町幕府最後の管領。
sen.e: Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA (1514-January 4, 1564) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the early Sengoku period and the last Kanrei (shogunal deputy) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA (1514 - January 14, 1564) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the early Sengoku period (period of warring states) and the last Kanrei (shogunal deputy) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。(period of warring states)説明補足しました。
sen.e: Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA (1514 - January 14, 1564) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the early Sengoku period (period of warring states) and the last Kanrei (shogunal deputy) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 細川尹賢の子で細川高国の養子。
sen.e: He was the son of Tadakata HOSOKAWA and the foster son of Takakuni HOSOKAWA.
He was the son of Tadakata HOSOKAWA and the foster son of Takakuni HOSOKAWA.
He was the son of Tadakata HOSOKAWA and the foster son of Takakuni HOSOKAWA.
Fujikata HOSOKAWA was his younger brother.
Fujikata HOSOKAWA was his younger brother.
Fujikata HOSOKAWA was his younger brother.
His alias was Ietsuna.
His alias was Ietsuna.
His alias was Ietsuna.
He was the a Settsu shugo (constable of Settsu Province).
He was the a Settsu shugo (constable of Settsu Province).
He was the a Settsu shugo (constable of Settsu Province).

sen.j: 復権をめざして1543年、細川晴元を討つため和泉国で挙兵する。
sen.e: With the aim of reinstatement, Ujitsuna raised armies in Izumi Province in 1543 in order to take revenge on Harumoto HOSOKAWA.
With the aim of reinstatement, Ujitsuna raised armies in Izumi Province in 1543 in order to take revenge on Harumoto HOSOKAWA.
With the aim of reinstatement, Ujitsuna raised armies in Izumi Province in 1543 in order to take revenge on Harumoto HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 畠山氏や遊佐氏、筒井氏などの畿内の有力者や、将軍足利義晴の支持をえたものの、当初は晴元の強大な力の前に圧倒的に不利であった。
sen.e: Although he was backed by powerful clans in the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), including the Hatakeyama clan, the Yusa clan and the Tsutsui clan, and Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, Shogun, he was at a great disadvantage at first because Harumoto had great power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although he was backed by powerful clans in the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), including the Hatakeyama clan, the Yusa clan and the Tsutsui clan, and Shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, he was at a great disadvantage at first because Harumoto had great power.
sen.cmt: Shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGAに訂正しました。
sen.e: Although he was backed by powerful clans in the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), including the Hatakeyama clan, the Yusa clan and the Tsutsui clan, and Shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, he was at a great disadvantage at first because Harumoto had great power.

sen.j: しかし、晴元の家臣・三好長慶が裏切って味方となったために形勢は一変（江口の戦い）し、1549年遂に晴元を近江国へと追放することに成功した。
sen.e: However, he finally pulled off banishing Harumoto to Omi Province in 1549 after the tide turned because Nagayoshi MIYOSHI who was the vassal of Harumoto betrayed Harumoto and took sides with Ujitsuna (Battle of Eguchi).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he finally pulled off banishing Harumoto to Omi Province in 1549 after the tide turned because Nagayoshi MIYOSHI who was the vassal of Harumoto betrayed Harumoto and took sides with Ujitsuna (Battle of Eguchi).

However, he finally pulled off banishing Harumoto to Omi Province in 1549 after the tide turned because Nagayoshi MIYOSHI who was the vassal of Harumoto betrayed Harumoto and took sides with Ujitsuna (Battle of Eguchi).

sen.j: 1552年、長慶とともに上洛し、管領に任じられた。
sen.e: In 1552, Ujitsuna went to the capital with Nagayoshi and was appointed to Kanrei.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1552, Ujitsuna went to the capital with Nagayoshi and was appointed to Kanrei.
In 1552, Ujitsuna went to the capital with Nagayoshi and was appointed to Kanrei.

sen.j: しかし、氏綱は長慶の傀儡でしかなく、実権は全く無かった。
sen.e: However he was just a puppet of Nagayoshi and didn't have any real power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However he was just a puppet of Nagayoshi and didn't have any real power.
However he was just a puppet of Nagayoshi and didn't have any real power.

sen.j: そして山城国の淀古城に長慶の監視付きで居城を与えられた氏綱は、1563年に失意のうちに死去した。
sen.e: After that, Ujitsuna was given Yodo kojo Castle in Yamashiro Province but monitored by Nagayoshi, and he died in despair and hopelessness in 1563.
After that, Ujitsuna was given Yodo-kojo Castle in Yamashiro Province but monitored by Nagayoshi, and he died in despair and hopelessness in 1563.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: After that, Ujitsuna was given Yodo-kojo Castle in Yamashiro Province but monitored by Nagayoshi, and he died in despair and hopelessness in 1563.

sen.j: その後、後任の管領が任じられる事は遂に無かった。
sen.e: Since then, nobody was appointed to Kanrei in the end.
Since then, nobody was appointed to Kanrei in the end.
Since then, nobody was appointed to Kanrei in the end.
